name: Strange idea, but.... Did anyone try making a F10/WM10/B20?
author: Cornflower

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content:
Right now I can't be bothered to make it myself, so as a lazy person I ask you guys... Wouldn't a F10/WM10/B20 be a nice combo? You get full attacks and full AB if you take all bard levels post-epic. You get around +3 AB and +5AC from the bard song. You can get UMD and Tumble as well as Lingering Song. You get some magic.

Thoughts from the pros?

posts.content: With Bard 16 / WM 16 / Fighter 8, you don't lose an AB, but actually gain an AB.  You get +1 AB at WM  13, negating the AB loss for taking Bard 4 pre-epic, and then another +1 AB at WM 16.  Also, you want at least 1 level of Fighter in epic for EWS.

posts.author: Cornflower

Bard 20 gives you Lasting Inspiration. F13/WM7 gives you max AB pre-epic, but not EWS, etc. etc. Lots of parameters here. I think if you can live without Lasting Inspiration, the best split is probably B16/F8/WM16, since as Empyre stated above, it gives you +2AB from WM levels, one fighter level post-epic (EWS).

Or, am I missing something?

posts.author: Mirnaia
posts.content: Lasting inspiration allows you to spend your song charges on curse song, using it basically every fight, and makes its use a lot safer. Because you have the buff song up "all the time", you just curse and start fighting immediately. If you don't, you have to buff very often (even more often than a cleric!), and you lose a round of the song while you curse. 1 round out of 10-15 is a lot more than that same round out of 100. Lasting inspiration is not only convenient, but broadens your possibilities.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hi Cornflower, sorry I missed this earlier. I have a few thoughts, if that's ok?

First of all - and I'm assuming this is for BSK - is Dev Crit that desirable? If it is, then your DC (Difficulty Class) isn't going to be that high, so you might want to think about scimitar rather than battle-axe.

If it's not, then that frees up several feats - for example 2 more Great Strengths and Knockdown, if you choose to keep Power Attack and Cleave. Of course, if you lose them, that would allow for taking Curse and Lingering Song pre-epic if you juggle your Bard levels around a bit (like taking Bard 1 at level 3, 6 or 9, and Bard 2 at level 12) and altering the order in which you take your feats. If you did that, that's 2 more general epic feats freed up for more strength.

Also, as far as the skills are concerned, you only need a modified Perform of 30 to max your level 16 Song, and it would be good to take UMD to at least a modified 33 (gives you guaranteed success with any scroll), or even 35. That would leave a spare 10 or 12 points to allocate, and with Bard as the final level, you can boost Spellcraft by a further 5 ranks to give another +1 vs spells.

I'd also be looking to take WS before Spring Attack (at Fighter 4), btw.

Hope this helps!

Cheers
